intro: Pisonia pacurero, commonly known as the Pacific pisonia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a glossy appearance. Pisonia pacurero is adapted to coastal environments and is often found in sandy soils near the shoreline.
